report_title: Engine & Turbine Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Engine and turbine manufacturers produce diesel truck engines, power transmission turbines and industrial transmissions. In addition to the production of engines and turbines, they also produce the parts and pieces required to fix and update existing products. Demand for these engines and turbines is reliant on a few different things. Exports and global trade conditions are the most important area since a lot of activity is generated through global trade. Through 2024 the industry faced significant problems stemming from global trade. This included an appreciating dollar, which made domestically produced goods less attractive to foreign buyers, as well as global supply chain disruptions, which would inevitably increase the cost of oil and steel.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: PROFIT TOOK HUGE HITS OVER THE PAST FIVE YEARS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Massive fluctuations in the price of input commodities have dampened performance through 2024. In 2021, the price of steel and crude oil rose to historic highs. While most manufacturers were able to pass the increased costs onto downstream buyers, the spike in oil put downward pressure on industry profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: PANDEMIC-INDUCED DISRUPTIONS AND SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES RESULTED IN NEGATIVE TRADE CONDITIONS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Engine and turbine manufacturers faced severe international trade disruptions. Coming off global scale disruptions caused by the pandemic, manufacturers had to adjust operations to accommodate the rapid appreciation of the dollar.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: HEIGHTENED BUSINESS ACTIVITY AND A CLIMB IN ELECTRIC POWER CONSUMPTION LIMIT REVENUE DECLINES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Given the falling exports through most of the period, industry performance was expectedly lackluster.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DESPITE OTHER LIMITING FACTORS, EXPORT GROWTH WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Diesel engines and utility turbines are a major source of demand for engine and turbine manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FALLING PRICES OF OIL WILL EASE PRESSURE ON PROFIT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Following years of historically high oil prices during the current period, oil prices are expected to decline and stabilize.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: REGULATIONS AND PREFERENCES WILL WIDEN DEMAND FROM DOWNSTREAM MARKETS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers in this industry will face mounting federal and state regulations moving forward.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture turbines and equipment used for power transmission, such as generators, in addition to diesel engines for highway vehicles and heavy-duty equipment.
key_trends: Low-interest rates have resulted in rapid expansion.
EPA regulations will support new product manufacturing.
Exports fell drastically due to global trade disruptions.
Regulations from the EPA have pushed manufacturers to adapt their processes.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment primarily supplies trucking, rail, marine and other freight-related sectors.
Public utilities utilize turbines to generate and regulate power distribution.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes diesel- and natural gas-powered engines.
This includes turbine generators and accessories.
Natural gas engines include liquefied natural gas engines.

tier_1_suppliers: Nonferrous Metal Refining in the US
Metal Plating & Treating in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Copper, Nickel, Lead & Zinc Mining in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Rising Price of Oil and EPA Regulations Drive Down Demand for Diesel and Semidiesel Engines
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for traditional diesel engines has diminished.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for Power Generation Remains High
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Energy consumption has kept demand for equipment high.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports decline despite an appreciation of the US dollar.
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports have grown to satisfy over one-half of domestic demand.

business_locations.location_description: Home to the highest percent of establishments in the industry.
Has a significant concentration of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Issued emission guidelines for diesel engines.

factors_decreased_barrier: Significant capital is needed for start-up costs.

basis_points.basis_description: Low interest rates allowed major players to expand.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Major players acquired companies with green tech initiatives.

FAQs.question: Was your company affected significantly by import competition from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports increase competition for domestic manufacturers.
